Miles Sound System SDK 6.6h

Miles 2D-based M3D Preferences

Discussion

The Miles 2D-based providers (Fast 2D and Dolby Surround) publish several settings to control environmental reverb effects. Reverb can provide a lot of "feel" to a room, so this is a great option for fast 3D audio.

In version 6.5, the software providers switched to using new global software reverb. That means room reverb effects now cost almost no CPU at all (about 0.25% - one forth of one percent - per sample on a P3/500)!! You can now agressively use reverb to increase your game's realism without sweating the CPU use.

The Miles 2D provider-level preferences are:

"Mute at maximum": this preference controls whether sound is muted outside of the maximum distance (which is the default), or whether sound just stops falling off outside the maximum distance.
